pullrequest.title: Andrei Haidu GSOC fluid plugin with Fluidix

content.html:
wow, that's a lot of h's. Fun note, apparently in C++11 this is no longer necessary and about as efficient as using std::pow. (http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/numeric/math/pow)

Anyway, if we're not living in C++11-landia, consider a helper function like this (from http://www.overclockers.com/forums/showthread.php/380512-Wow-a-big-C-C-code-speedup!!!):

double intpow( double base, int exponent ) { int i; double out = base; for( i=1 ; i < exponent ; i++ ) { out *= base; } return out; }

it's just a bit more readable :)
